sub_title: Biology teacher and mentor  at Luzac Eindhoven
summary:
I am a passionate biologist (molecular and ecology) and science teacher. I enjoy working with all different types of people and share thoughts and experiences about various subjects.

My greatest drive is to share my zeal for Biology and to contribute to the development of new ideas and research. The variety of roles I have had in educational and non-edicational positions within  international work environments has provided me with extensive experience in many fields I.e. biodiversity project management, education and pedagogy, didactical skills, education management and innovation, formative evaluation, people management,  laboratory skills, use of molecular techniques (PCR, RFLP, ISSR), research and development, project management and leadership. 
In my current job I teach Biology at Keystage 5  and undergraduate students. 
I currently coordinate the Duke of Edinburgh Silver award at the largest DofE centre in Surrey. For this I am HML trained and am a certified leader. Running this award has equipped me with problem solving skills, organisation skills and management experience and outdoor expeditions Management. 


Skills:
International teaching experience, both secondary and postsecondary (higher)  (Netherlands, UK and Canada), knowledge of different education systems, formative assessment evaluation strategies. Education innovation. 

Ecological and Molecular research/ techniques (PCR, RFLP, ISSR) and laboratory organisation . Extensive knowledge of flora, fauna, (European, UK and Canada) ecosystems and biodiversity projects, Green legislation (i.e. Natura 2000) , Natural education and biology, Communications and organisational skills.
International research experience (ecological field studies in UK, NL, Switzerland and Canada). 
Language skills: Native in English and Dutch, proficient in German, French.
